phone.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Much of his work is done by phone.
Who was that on the phone?
I wish Amy would get off the phone.
phone.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the part of a telephone into which you speak
phone.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: He put the phone down on me (=ended the call before I had finished speaking).
phone.translation[0].note_box[0].section: use the phone
Do you mind if I use your phone?
the phone rings
Around three o’clock, the phone rang.
answer the phone
My dad answered the phone.
put the phone down
I only remembered his name after I had put the phone down.
slam the phone down
I was so mad I just slammed the phone down.
talk/speak (to somebody) on the phone
We talk on the phone every day.
We spoke earlier on the phone, if you remember.
come to the phone
I’m sorry, she can’t come to the phone right now.
be on the phone to somebody
I was on the phone to my mother all morning.
be wanted on the phone
Larry, tell Rosemary that she’s wanted on the phone.
call somebody on the phone
I called her on the phone and invited her to Las Vegas.
get on the phone to somebody
We got on the phone to the hospital straight away.
phone + NOUN
a phone number
Can I have your phone number?
a phone line
Listeners jammed the phone lines, demanding to hear the song.
a phone bill
Our last phone bill was huge.
a phone company
I switched phone companies.
a phone conversation
Neither man denies the phone conversation took place.
the phone is busy
I tried you earlier, but your phone was engaged.
the phone goes/is dead
Before he could reply, the phone suddenly went dead.
the phone is off the hook
On Friday nights we just take the phone off the hook and relax.
phone.translation[0].note_box[1].section: My wife was talking to someone on the phone.
What’s your home phone number?
The nearest telephone was in the school secretary’s office.
mobile phone
a telephone that you can carry with you, that works by using a network of radio stations to pass on signals
Even children as young as eight have mobile phones.
She always has her mobile switched off.
cell phone
a mobile phone
You can reach me on my cell phone.
voice mail
a system that records messages so that you can listen to them on your phone
Let me check my voice mail.
text message
a message from someone that you can read on your mobile phone
I got a text from Paul.
landline
a telephone that uses wires – used when comparing this with a mobile phone
Calls cost 25p from a landline, more from a mobile phone.
receiver
the part of a telephone that you pick up to listen and talk
She put down the receiver and started crying.
phone.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to speak to someone by telephone
phone.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Why didn’t they phone the police?
Stevie phoned to say that he was going to be late.
I kept phoning her up, asking to meet her.
Tell him to phone back  (=telephone again at a later time) tomorrow.
phone.translation[1].note_box[0].section: to speak to someone by telephone. Phone is more common in British English than American English
to phone someone. Call is used in both British and American English
One of the neighbors called the police.
to phone someone.  Ring is more informal than phone or call
I can ring her at the office tomorrow.
If you ever come to Seattle, give me a call.
I’ll give the hospital a ring and see how he is.
Angry listeners telephoned the BBC to complain.
to make a telephone call using special software that allows you to make calls over the Internet
I Skyped her last night and we spoke for hours.
phone.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: an instrument or machine relating to sound or hearing, especially a musical instrument
phone.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: earphones  (=for listening to a radio etc)
phone.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: someone who speaks a particular language
phone.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: Francophone nations  (=nations where French is spoken)
phone.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: a piece of equipment you use to talk to someone who is in another place
phone.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: to make a phone call to someone
phone.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: You can phone our customer support line at any time.
I phoned up yesterday to check if the order had been sent.
